home.description: My name is Guillermo, and I love ideating and building stuff ğŸ’¡
home.content: I'm a Software Engineer with a strong product mindset cultivated by engaging with users, analysing problems, and participating in every aspect of the software development life cycle.

content.1: I'm proud of the diverse skills I've developed throughout my journey. They've been instrumental in my past accomplishments and serve as a solid foundation for my goal of becoming a T-shaped professional.
How I became a Software Engineer
It started in the '90s when my parents bought our first computer. It quickly became a fundamental part of my activities and entertainment.
content.4: I started building custom computers and scripts.

content.1: This was my first hard lesson, as I didn't complete my Telecom degree and it cost me time to accept it.
content.2: Thanks to my time at the university, however, I identified some of my strengths and weaknesses, and the experience laid the groundwork for what my career would become in the future.

4.content: As I loved coding, I decided to pursue a career in Software Development and traced a plan to achieve it: I became a self-taught developer, worked part-time as an IT technician, and got a diploma in Cross-platform Software Development.

content.1: I secured an internship in an Edinburgh-based consultancy, so I left my comfort zone and devoted myself to making the most out of this opportunity.
content.2: I got my first Web Developer role ğŸ‰

content.1: I became part of an awesome crew at Rooser that worked very hard to bring transparency and certainty into the seafood industry. As one of their first employees, I quickly became involved in many areas apart from development, shifting my role from Software Developer to Software Engineer ğŸ–ï¸
content.2: This experience also helped me develop a product and user-first mindset through participating in multiple design sprints, user interviews, and having extreme ownership of what we built and delivered to our users.

content.1: I decided to take some time off to work on personal projects
content.3: and upskill. I also explored the option of relocating to New Zealand and continue my journey in the other hemisphere, but the timing was not the right one, so it had to be postponed indefinitely.

content.1: Got my first specialised role as a Front-end Developer ğŸ–ï¸
content.2: This opportunity allowed me to fill the gaps in some of the areas I couln't experience in a start-up environment and, on top of that, gave me the change to work closely with exceptionally skilled people who set new standards for me every day ğŸ¤©

content.1: I consider myself calm and friendly; always seeing the good in people. I don't like to jump to conclusions quickly and enjoy debating ideas to learn more about how others think.
content.2: A bit of a shy extrovert, I'm comfortable in small groups and -
content.3: despite getting nervous in front of bigger audiences
content.4: - feel happy to present my ideas to larger and non-technical audiences.
content.5: When it comes to working as part of a team, I enjoy helping others as it's always a good learning opportunity and preserves the team's momentum.
